Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "关于 v-if v-show 的不足" (#7062) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
我一个tab页，里面有很多个选项卡，每个选项卡有ajax请求，那么问题来了
如果用 v-show，就会在页面一打开产生很多ajax请求，会有些卡顿
如果用 v-if，就会在用户每次切换ajax会重新请求一遍，然后之前的浏览记录也没了

### What does the proposed API look like?
希望提供一个类似 v-show 或 v-if 的指令
在没有“显示过”时不渲染组件
在“显示过后” 再次切换“显示或隐藏”不重复安装组件

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Component is patching all SVG's elements (in IE) when updateComponent is triggered" (#7061) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.3

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/eoviedo/64j9x1f0/](https://jsfiddle.net/eoviedo/64j9x1f0/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the attached jsfiddle in IE 11
1. Open Developer tools
1. Start a new profiling session
1. Hover the text 'Hover me!' with the pointer few times
1. Stop the profiling session
1. Inspect the results and find the overhead

### What is expected?
VueJS should update only the class of the parent element and it should not do any operation with the SVG elements inside the component.

### What is actually happening?
VueJS is calling patchVnode for every SVG element inside the component in IE only

---
This is happening in IE 11 and is fairly noticeable when there are a important number of SVG element in the page.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue " Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined." (#1882) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/aeolusheath/vue-router-project](https://github.com/aeolusheath/vue-router-project)

### Steps to reproduce
router/index.js config like this :

```
import Vue from 'vue'
import Router from 'vue-router'


Vue.use(Router)

export default new Router({
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'HelloWorld',
      component: require('../components/HelloWorld.vue')
    },
    {
      path: '/test',
      name: 'Test',
      component: require('../components/Test.vue')
    }
  ]
})

```

### What is expected?
work right...no warn or error:

```
 Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined.
```

route can work right, and is there some way to avoid to import first and use it in router config.

I just wanna do it like before. straightly use component: require('xxxxx')

### What is actually happening?
I update webpack and vue-router to newest version, but actually before I use 1.X.X of webpack and vue-router@2.4.0 and they work fine

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "the method of router.back() won't working on <a href="#"> of iphone6s" (#1881) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody: ### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/cysean/xgrjzsup/4211/](https://jsfiddle.net/cysean/xgrjzsup/4211/) ### Steps to reproduce 1、click link "Go to Foo" 2、click link "Go to Bar" 3、click link "bar back to prev." ### What is expected? we can write $router.back() in a callback of click event of on any platform. ### What is actually happening? The method of $router.back() is not execute.

Events.RelatedBody:
Adding the feature discussed in #1037 

So, I'm not entirely sure about this commit and how it's to be deployed?
`/dist` doesn't seem to be in `.gitignore` so I've added it to the commit, but that seems a little weird. Additionally, I'm not too sure about the changes I've made in `src/index.esm.js` either.

If any further changes are required, please feel free to point them out
